moves.1... Nf6 2. c4 e6: This is all standard stuff at the moment
moves.3. Nc3 Bb4 4. Qc2 O-O 5. a3 Bxc3+: Black gives white the bishop, but is a little ahead in development
moves.6. Qxc3 b6 7. g3 Bb7 8. Nf3 Bxf3: Two knights against two bishops and white moves the quenn again
moves.9. Qxf3 Nc6 10. e3: The black squared bishop is blocked in
moves.10... e5 11. dxe5 Nxe5 12. Qf5 d6 13. Bg: It is all even, black has plans for the queen side
moves.17. Rad1 b5 18. cxb5 Rxb5 19. Qc2 Rc5 20: Black is slowly pushing white into defensive positions although must guard against the range of white's pieces
moves.26. Qd3 Re8 27. h4 c4: Black can cause chaos with this pawn now
moves.28. Qd4 Rc6 29. Bc3 Ndf6 30. a4 d5 31. K: The pawn marches on and the knight at e4 is well placed
